meanings.definition: In a metaphorical or symbolic sense.
meanings.sent1: She said she was as light as a feather figuratively, meaning she felt very happy.
meanings.sent2: He figuratively painted a picture with his words, describing the scene in vivid detail.
meanings.sent3: The cat figuratively danced around the room, chasing an imaginary mouse.
meanings.sent4: His heart figuratively soared like a bird as he watched his child succeed.
meanings.sent5: The idea of freedom was figuratively a bright light in the darkness of oppression.

meanings.sent1: When she said she could eat a horse figuratively, she meant she was very hungry.
meanings.sent2: The storm outside was figuratively a raging beast, shaking the windows with its fury.
meanings.sent3: The teacher figuratively had eyes in the back of her head, catching every mischievous act.
meanings.sent4: His excuses were figuratively a house of cards, easily falling apart under scrutiny.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room was figuratively a thick fog, making it hard to see clearly.
